wikipedia_page.main: Alfred René Jean Paul Ubbelohde  FRS (14 December 1907 – 7 January 1988) was a Belgian-born English physical chemist.

response: The method used to produce HOPG is based on the process used to make pyrolytic graphite, but with additional tensile stress in the basal-plane direction. This produces improved alignment of the graphite crystallites and an interplanar spacing close to that observed in natural graphite. The "stress recrystallization" of graphite was first described by L. C. F. Blackman and Alfred Ubbelohde in 1962.

link_mentions.page: Department of Chemical Engineering, Imperial College London
response: * Alfred Ubbelohde FRS  – Head of the department from 1961 to 1975. Author of six books and over 400 publications, the Ubbelohde effect (the increase in hydrogen bond length due to deuteration) is named after him. He is also credited with coining the term proton conductor.
